ezvcard.io.chain

Class ChainingXmlWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ezvcard.io.chain.ChainingXmlWriter

  • public class ChainingXmlWriter
extends Object
    Chainer class for writing xCards (XML-encoded vCards).
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt
    See Also:
    Ezvcard.writeXml(Collection), Ezvcard.writeXml(VCard...)

    • Constructor Summary

      • ChainingXmlWriter

        public ChainingXmlWriter(Collection<VCard> vcards)
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • indent

        public ChainingXmlWriter indent(Integer indent)
        Sets the number of indent spaces to use for pretty-printing. If not set, then the XML will not be pretty-printed.
        Parameters:
        indent - the number of spaces in the indent string or null not to pretty-print (disabled by default)
        Returns:
        this

      • xmlVersion

        public ChainingXmlWriter xmlVersion(String xmlVersion)
        Sets the XML version to use. Note that many JDKs only support 1.0 natively. For XML 1.1 support, add a JAXP library like xalan to your project.
        Parameters:
        xmlVersion - the XML version (defaults to "1.0")
        Returns:
        this

      • outputProperty

        public ChainingXmlWriter outputProperty(String name,
                               String value)
        Assigns an output property to the JAXP transformer (see Transformer.setOutputProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)).
        Parameters:
        name - the property name
        value - the property value
        Returns:
        this

      • outputProperties

        public ChainingXmlWriter outputProperties(Map<String,String> outputProperties)
        Assigns all of the given output properties to the JAXP transformer (see Transformer.setOutputProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)).
        Parameters:
        outputProperties - the properties
        Returns:
        this

      • prodId

        public ChainingXmlWriter prodId(boolean include)
        Sets whether to add a ProductId property to each vCard that marks it as having been generated by this library. For 2.1 vCards, the extended property "X-PRODID" will be added, since ProductId is not supported by that version.
        Parameters:
        include - true to add the property, false not to (defaults to true)
        Returns:
        this

      • versionStrict

        public ChainingXmlWriter versionStrict(boolean versionStrict)
        Sets whether to exclude properties that do not support the target version from the written vCard.
        Parameters:
        versionStrict - true to exclude such properties, false not to (defaults to true)
        Returns:
        this

      • register

        public ChainingXmlWriter register(VCardPropertyScribe<? extends VCardProperty> scribe)
        Registers a property scribe.
        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe to register
        Returns:
        this

      • register

        public ChainingXmlWriter register(String parameterName,
                         VCardDataType dataType)
        Registers the data type of a non-standard parameter. Non-standard parameters use the "unknown" data type by default.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the parameter name (e.g. "x-foo")
        dataType - the data type
        Returns:
        this
